resources.string:
Fall in love with Berlin. 
Visit like the locals do. 
Let its romantic melancholy charm you. 
You will always want to come back.
Avant garde or classic. Berlin\'s museums and galleries are a must see in the contemporary art world. \nSee for yourself why every this metropolis is so appealing.
German food is much different from what you may have in mind. \nFresh and savory, open your senses and be prepared to be seduced by a new kind of cuisine.
One of the best alternative Film Festivals takes place in Berlin. \nDevoid of the political conflicts of Hollywood or Cannes the event never disappoints. Discover the venues that host it.
An elegant restaurant awarded a Michelin star for its quality cooking
An stylish restaurant that includes a fine selection for vegetarians. Open for brunch and dinner.
Named after the first radio station to broadcast from Berlin in 1920, this sushi & modern fare restaurant is a must visit in Berlin.
An escape into the beautiful Spree landscape. Vegetarian options available.

One place for all the arts.\nHave your choice between the Altes Museum, to admire to the Berlin goddess; the Pergamon Museum, home of the Babylon doors; Alte Nationalgalerie, to experience Rodin, Manet and many more classics; or the Neues Museum, where to surrender to the beauty of Nefertiti.
One of the most relevant venues for Contemporary Art in Berlin
Presenting the most relevant artists working in footgraphy and visual media today
An astonishing platform for contemporary sculpture, installation, and media art.

Built circa 1740, the summer estate of Prussian king Frederick the Great, the palace maintain its opulence unchanged.\nFeaturing ten main rooms across a single story. The park surrounding the complex is sprawling with gardens, colonnades, fountains and art. A terraced vineyard is placed at the foot of the palace.

We start at Proschwitz, a renown winery, the next tasting stop will be at Weinschaugarten, which offers wines typical of Vienna, including Riesling, Chardonnay, Grüner Veltiner.\nFrom there near Brandenburg Gate, Alexander Platz, Schlossplatz & Gendarmenmarkt. Ending at Weinbergsweg the last active vineyard in the city, which closed doors in 1912.

Berlin is home to 270 fountains. At the basin of the Luisenstädtischer canal, the Indian fountain was restored after Berlin\'s reunification. Viktoriapark displays artificial cascades in the city, built after Zackelfalls in the Giant Mountains, Alexanderplatz is home to the Fountain of People\'s Friendship is a favorite of many during busy Summer days. Enter the Grimm\'s brothers fairy tale space by visiting Märchenbrunnen.\nThe most beautiful fountain is small in size and is located in the Tiergarten, the Troton Fountain.

One of the jewels of the Enlightenment era, a dreamy space built in 1794 by Frederick William II and by Luise, wife of Friedrich Wilhem III. The castle \"Was a place of fun for kings to play peasant and peasant\" says Fontaine; a large landscaped garden designed to imitate nature.\nIf you enjoy this location, you should also visit the Gardens of the World in Marzahn
Presenting independent films, cultural amp; art movies.
Studying media art works from an intellectual and socio-political context while also providing scientific reflection.
A film museum with an extensive collection that includes international film productions as well as renown German film productions
International contemporary arts, with special focus on non-European productions.
